explanation: The issue lies in the assumption that the element 'x' will always be present in the list 'p'. The original code uses the 'index()' method, which will raise a ValueError if 'x' is not found. To fix this, I replaced the 'index()' method with 'p.index(x) if x in p else -1', which safely checks if 'x' is in 'p' before attempting to find its index. If 'x' is not found, it will return -1 instead of raising an error.
fixed_code:
n, x = map(int, input().split())
p = list(map(int, input().split()))
print(p.index(x) if x in p else -1)
